passage_text: 1 Unvaccinated adult dogs receive two rounds of vaccinations about three weeks apart. 2  After that, dogs usually receive boosters annually. 3  The basic shots -- for distemper, hepatitis, parvovirus, parainfluenza and sometimes leptospirosis and coronavirus -- usually are administered together in a combination vaccine. We just went in to give our puppy his second round of boosters and check up. The check up was 45$, the boosters cost 28$, and in addition, we got a stool to check for any existing worms, which cost 38$.

In addition to the DHLPP vaccines, the puppy should also get the rabies vaccine, which is $15 to $20. The average costs are around $100 for all the vaccines needed. The costs for the initial puppy vaccinations (during the first year) are higher than the costs of the vaccines needed in the following years. The booster shots may cost between $15 and $50 per year, depending on where you get them. You may find that the costs of the vaccines for a puppy vary from $20 to $150 or even higher. The costs may depend on several factors such as: 1  Location; the costs can vary in the country but may also differ within your city.

1 Rabies shots are given annually to dogs and typically cost $15-$35. 2  For example, the Animal Health Center, in New Hampshire, charges $20 for the annual vaccination. 3  Shots for bordetella, often called kennel cough, are recommended for those who visit dog parks of who board their puppies. 1 Shots for bordetella, often called kennel cough, are recommended for those who visit dog parks of who board their puppies. 2  Bordetella vaccines are generally given twice to puppies and cost about $20 per shot. 3  VIP Pet Care charges $19 for each Bordetella vaccine.

1 The average cost for dog vaccinations ranges from $20 to $150 in the first year, and from $10 to $100 per year afterward. We just went in to give our puppy his second round of boosters and check up. The check up was 45$, the boosters cost 28$, and in addition, we got a stool to check for any existing worms, which cost 38$.

1 The initial puppy shots -- often a combo shot for both parvovirus and distemper -- typically cost about $15-$30 per round, with three to four rounds of shots required starting at about 6-8 weeks of age, with boosters being given every two-three weeks thereafter. 2  The total cost for the series is typically $60-$120. 1 Shots for bordetella, often called kennel cough, are recommended for those who visit dog parks of who board their puppies. 2  Bordetella vaccines are generally given twice to puppies and cost about $20 per shot. 3  VIP Pet Care charges $19 for each Bordetella vaccine.

What should be included: 1  The initial puppy shots -- often a combo shot for both parvovirus and distemper -- typically cost about $15-$30 per round, with three to four rounds of shots required starting at about 6-8 weeks of age, with boosters being given every two-three weeks thereafter. 1 Shots for bordetella, often called kennel cough, are recommended for those who visit dog parks of who board their puppies. 2  Bordetella vaccines are generally given twice to puppies and cost about $20 per shot. 3  VIP Pet Care charges $19 for each Bordetella vaccine.

Best Answer: Your puppy will need 4 sets of shots until he's 4 months old. A set every 3 to 4 weeks. It costs about $45 each time. At 4 months he will then get his Rabies for the first time as well. Then he'll need a booster when he turns a year old. Then boosters every year after that and rabies booster every 3 to 5 years. Sometimes some pet stores or fire stations offer a low cost shot clinic for about $15.

1 Some dog daycare facilities or kennels require vaccinations not included in the standard round of shots, such as for bordatella, known as kennel cough. 2  In certain parts of the country, veterinarians recommend extra vaccinations, such as for Lyme disease. 3  Extra vaccinations usually cost about $10 to $15 or more each. We just went in to give our puppy his second round of boosters and check up. The check up was 45$, the boosters cost 28$, and in addition, we got a stool to check for any existing worms, which cost 38$.

Average Cost of Pet Vaccinations. The cost for vaccinating puppies or pets in the first year ranges from $20 to $200. Cost of immunization of adult dogs ranges from $60 to $100 annually. Canine vaccination costs differ due to the dog's age and varying vet charges. Since puppies are at a high risk of exposure to disease, puppy vaccinations are recommended as early as 5 weeks of age. Along with the cost of immunizations, pet owners are required to pay additional costs toward laboratory tests, physical examinations and routine parasite treatment or control. The cost of veterinary care for puppies ranges from $100 to $200. Veterinary care for older dogs costs nearly $150 to $25
